premise: A woman in a gray sweater holds a broom in a doorway.
hypothesis: The woman holds the broom.
explanation_1: A woman is in a doorway.

premise: A young man with glasses wearing a white t-shirt and dark pants wipes his nose with his left hand.
hypothesis: A young man wipes his nose.
explanation_1: wipes his nose is the same action.

premise: A man and a woman wearing white shirts in a wooded area.
hypothesis: A man and woman are wearing shirts.
explanation_1: People wearing white shirts are wearing shirts.

premise: A man in red swimming trunks pushing a baby stroller down a crowded beach.
hypothesis: A man pushes a baby stroller down a beach
explanation_1: The man pushes a stroller.

premise: A man is climbing his way up a rope as part of a Crossfit exercise.
hypothesis: A man is working out.
explanation_1: climbing rope is a form of working out.

premise: An adult and a child, both wearing hats, are outside, looking at a black and white rooster in a cage.
hypothesis: Two people watch a chicken.
explanation_1: if there is an adult and a child looking at a rooster in a cage then there are two people watching a chicken.

premise: A man hiking his way in the snow.
hypothesis: A man is hiking in snow.
explanation_1: hiking his way is another way of saying hiking

premise: Two young boys in blue jackets and helmets are racing their brown horses down a muddy trail.
hypothesis: Humans racing
explanation_1: Boys are humans.

premise: a small brown and black dog lying down in a furry rug.
hypothesis: The dog is warm
explanation_1: Sentence 1 is missing dog is warm

premise: A young, blond boy sitting in a white chair beside cactus plants is eating a sandwich.
hypothesis: a child is outside eating lunch
explanation_1: The fact that a child is eating a sandwich doesn't imply they are eating lunch.

premise: Four cheerleaders in a row are being thrown into the air simultaneously by four separate men.
hypothesis: The cheerleaders are women.
explanation_1: Just because four cheerleaders in a row are being thrown in the air does not mean they are women.

premise: Young girl in pink T-shirt and black leggings tosses blue football in grassy open area.
hypothesis: The girl is playing with the ball at the park.
explanation_1: The girl could be in many different locations and is not necessarily at the park.

premise: A group of kids with balloon hats are sitting on the ground.
hypothesis: A bunch of kids at a birthday party are watching a clown.
explanation_1: The balloons and costume may not be of birthday party and the kids are sitting there not watching a clown

premise: Three men are working on a bicycle, which has been positioned upside down.
hypothesis: Three men are fixing a bicycle for a customer who brought it in.
explanation_1: Just because the men are working on a bike doesn't mean it is for a customer.

premise: A young girl, wearing a red shirt and with an animal painted face, painting her own picture.
hypothesis: A young girl paints her own picture for an art competition
explanation_1: Painting does not mean painting for an art competition

premise: A small black dog is in the grass.
hypothesis: A dog might be black but is hidden in the grass.
explanation_1: Just because the dog is in the grass does not mean it is hidden.

premise: A German Shepherd is running with a stick in its mouth.
hypothesis: A Husky is running with a stick in its mouth.
explanation_1: A German Shepherd is not the same breed of dog as a Husky.

premise: A person is in a race car on a track with a lot debri.
hypothesis: A person riding a bike down a dirt hill
explanation_1: A person is either in a race car or riding a bike.

premise: A closeup of a girl from the backside playing a game on a screen.
hypothesis: A girl is watching a television show.
explanation_1: Playing a game is a different activity to watching a television show

premise: A young kid at the beach.
hypothesis: The beach is completely empty.
explanation_1: If there is a young kid at the beach, it is impossible that the beach is completely empty.

premise: A woman in a white shirt sitting on a gray bench in front of a wall with graffiti written on it.
hypothesis: A woman is napping
explanation_1: A woman cannot be napping while sitting on a bench.

premise: A woman working on a large machine which she appears to be using to make a blanket of some sort.
hypothesis: A woman standing by a microwave.
explanation_1: The woman cannot stand by a microwave and work on a machine.

premise: There is a guy barbecuing and he is wearing glasses and a red hat.
hypothesis: A man cooking something in a pot
explanation_1: When barbecuing people don't cook with a pot.

premise: A woman is wearing a jacket that has an image of an eye on the back of it.
hypothesis: The man is fighitng another man
explanation_1: woman and man different genders
